IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO TRANSFORM THE HEARTS, MINDS AND EATING HABITS OF YOUNG NEW YORKERS THROUGH A SEED-TO-TABLE EDUCATION THAT IS INTEGRATED IN SCHOOLS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EDIBLE SCHOOLYARD NYC WORKS WITH PUBLIC SCHOOLS TO CULTIVATE HEALTHY STUDENTS AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH HANDS-ON COOKING AND GARDENING EDUCATION, TRANSFORMING CHILDREN'S RELATIONSHIP WITH FOOD AND SUPPORTABLE EDIBLE EDUCATION FOR EVERY NEW YORK CITY CHILD.
IRS990.Desc: PUBLIC SCHOOL 216 - THE ARTURO TOSCANINI SCHOOL IN GRAVESEND BROOKLYN, WAS THE ORGANIZATION'S INAUGURAL DEMONSTRATION SCHOOL AND SITE FOR THEIR MODEL GARDEN AND KITCHEN CLASSROOM PROGRAMS AND A CUSTOM DESIGNED KITCHEN CLASSROOM AND HALF-ACRE GARDEN. THE GARDEN PROGRAM PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING THAT CULTIVATES THE NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NEEDED TO ADAPT HEALTHY EATING BEHAVIORS. IN THE GARDEN, STUDENTS LEARN TO SERVE AS STEWARDS OF THE LAND AND HOW TO GROW THEIR OWN FRESH, ORGANIC FOOD. EACH GARDEN IS INTERDISCIPLINARY AND PROJECT BASED AND INCORPORATES AT LEAST ONE OF THE COMMON CORE STATE STANDARDS IN ELA/MATH OR THE NY STATE LEARNING STANDARD IN SCIENCE AND SOCIAL STUDIES.KITCHEN CLASSROOMS PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH THE SKILLS NEEDED TO ADOPT HEALTHY EATING BEHAVIORS. IN THE KITCHEN CLASSROOM, STUDENTS COOK TOGETHER WITH FRESHLY HARVESTED PRODUCE FROM THE EDIBLE SCHOOLYARD GARDEN AND EAT A FRESHLY PREPARED DISH AROUND A COMMUNAL TABLE. THE KITCHEN CURRICULUM INCLUDES NUTRITION EDUCATION AND COOKING LESSONS THAT ARE STANDARDS BASED, AND LIKE THE GARDEN LESSONS, CONTAIN CLASSROOM EXTENSIONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PUBLIC SCHOOL 7 - IN APRIL 2013 A SECOND DEMONSTRATION SCHOOL WAS ADDED, P.S/M.S. 7 IN EAST HARLEM, AN ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL CO-LOCATED WITH A GRADE 6-8 PUBLIC MIDDLE SCHOOL, GLOBAL TECHNOLOGY PREPARATORY. LOCATED AT 120TH STREET AND LEXINGTON AVENUE - A NEIGHBORHOOD WITH LIMITED ACCESS TO FRESH PRODUCE AND SOME OF NYC'S HIGHEST LEVELS OF POVERTY AND OBESITY - THE TITLE 1-FUNDED SCHOOLS SERVE OVER FIVE HUNDRED PRE-K THROUGH 8TH GRADE STUDENTS. THE STUDENT BODY REFLECTS BOTH THE DIVERSITY AND THE ECONOMIC CHALLENGES OF THE COMMUNITY OF EAST HARLEM: 57% OF THE STUDENTS COME FROM A LATINO OR HISPANIC BACKGROUND 37% OF THE STUDENTS ARE BLACK OR AFRICAN AMERICAN 45% OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD POPULATION RECEIVES INCOME SUPPORT 64% OF HOUSEHOLDS RECEIVE SNAP BENEFITSKIDS ARE NOW LEARNING IN A 2,000-SQUARE-FOOT CONTAINER GARDEN AND A FORMER CLASSROOM WHICH WAS CONVERTED INTO KITCHEN SPACE. IN FALL 2016, THE ORGANIZATION OPENED A 2,300-SQUARE-FOOT ROOFTOP TEACHING GARDEN, COMPLETE WITH A GREENHOUSE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NETWORK SCHOOLS - THE NETWORK SCHOOLS PROGRAM BRINGS SEED-TO-TABLE EDUCATION TO FOUR SCHOOLS IN THE SOUTH BRONX AND CENTRAL BROOKLYN THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP WITH FOODCORPS. NETWORK SCHOOLS EXPAND ON THE DEMONSTRATION SCHOOL MODEL TO MAKE FOOD EDUCATION ACCESSIBLE TO EVEN MORE NYC KIDS. THEY ARE IN NEIGHBORHOODS IDENTIFIED BY THE NYC DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AS HAVING HIGH RATES OF DIET-RELATED DISEASES AND LARGE NUMBERS OF CHILDREN FROM LOW-INCOME FAMILIES. THE ORGANIZATION WORKS CLOSELY WITH NETWORK SCHOOL STAFF AND COMMUNITIES TO EXPAND GARDENS, ADD KITCHEN CLASSES, AND PROMOTE A VIBRANT CULTURE AROUND HEALTHY FOOD. NETWORK SCHOOL COMMUNITIES LEARN TO GROW AND MANAGE THEIR OWN EDIBLE EDUCATION PROGRAMS. EACH SCHOOL'S PROGRAM IS UNIQUE, BASED ON THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS, GOALS, AND RESOURCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT - A PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM WAS LAUNCHED IN AN EFFORT TO TRAIN TEACHERS, NON-PROFIT LEADERS AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES IN STARTING, MANAGING AND TEACHING FROM GARDEN AND KITCHEN CLASSROOMS IN THEIR OWN SCHOOL ENVIRONMENTS. TEACHERS FROM ACROSS THE CITY SPEND TIME IN THE DEMONSTRATION SCHOOL GARDENS, COOK IN THEIR KITCHENS, AND LEARN WHAT THEY NEED TO KNOW TO BRING EDIBLE EDUCATION TO THEIR OWN SCHOOLS. PROGRAMS WERE OFFERED FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION CREDITS FOR NEW YORK CITY PUBLIC SCHOOL TEACHERS, AS WELL AS NON-CREDIT DAY-LONG AND AFTERSCHOOL SESSIONS.PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION - CONTINUING ADMINISTRATION RELATING TO ALL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.PROGRAM EVALUATION - EVALUATION OF EXISTING PROGRAMS AND POTENTIAL NEW PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY (OR ASSET) IF THE ORGANIZATION HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018, NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS WERE TAKEN OR ARE EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DRAFT TAX RETURN IS PROVIDED TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE ORGANIZATION, THEN IT IS DISCUSSED WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND MONITORS AND REVIEWS THE POLICY ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS INITIALLY DETERMINED BY ANALYZING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARIES AT COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVE ANY CHANGES TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS SALARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AFOREMENTIONED FORMS ARE AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE COMMITTEE MEETS REGULARLY AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 13
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ADOPTED A WHISTLEBLOWER POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 14
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ADOPTED A DOCUMENT RETENTION POLICY.
